A nation whose most visible leaders & institutions rely on anger to motivate people will eventually become a nation of very angry people. 

Anger can make good people take irresponsible & destructive actions. But Anger will lead evil people to take horrifying & tragic ones. 4/4

Great movements are always based on optimism & inspiration. 

But optimism requires more patience than fear. 

An outrage based media focuses coverage on anger & generally ignores inspiration.

And our culture rewards harsh rhetoric & views measured words as weak or boring 3/4

History offers numerous examples of social & political movements built primarily on tapping into & stoking anger. To varying degrees they had some early success, but none of them ended well. 

And many of them caused great suffering & tragedy on the way down. 2/4

Our core problem isn‚Äôt ‚ÄúIncendiary rhetoric‚Äù it‚Äôs the Anger it taps into & stokes. 

Anger moves people to donate & vote. And outrage is good for media ratings & online traffic. 

Because anger is one of our most powerful emotions. But it is also one of our most destructive. 1/4
